info.description: Lay track, buy stock, and dump companies at opportune times to get big payouts.
info.helpText:
Players choose a seat by clicking any "click to sit" buttons, then type in their name and select their desired color in the popup window. Sit down by clicking the green "Go" button.

After all players have chosen seats,  any one player must click the "Setup" button, click the check box in the popup window, and then click the "Reset the game!" button. This will randomly determine the starting player and reveal the initial auction interface.

INITIAL AUCTION
Click and drag the left-most stock from the auction row, and place it into the grey box to the right. A bidding interface will appear, and clicking on the + and - buttons will increase and decrease your bid value for the current stock. To buy the stock, click the "Buy Company Color Stock" button on this interface. The purchased stock will automatically be placed in the winning player's portfolio, the bid value will be deducted from their money, and the associated stock price token will be place on the railroad value matching the bid value. Then, drag the next stock into the grey box to begin the following auction.

Standard Turns
After the auction is complete, the player who bought the cheapest stock will automatically become the active player.

Once done with their turn, the player should click the "Click to end turn" button button to the left of their name, which will move to the next player in order. The next player will hear a soft sound and a text alert on screen, reminding them that their turn has begun.  Any players who do not want to hear the sound and/or see the text alert when it is their turn can click the "Turn Options" button in the bottom left corner and change their preference.

Hovering your mouse over the white box above the Railroad Value chart will reveal helpful player aids.

In order to edit their current total money amount, the player must left click on the "edit money" button to the left of their money value, type a number into the box, and press enter (or click the green "pay" button). A positive number inputted will increase the resource by that amount, a negative number will decrease by that amount. 

Stocks and track that are removed from play can be dragged into the trash basket above the Dividends track on the right side of the screen. Any item placed into the trash can be brought back out by clicking and dragging on the basket icon.

fields.label: Type the number of money gained or lost. Put a - before the number to lose money.

info_game_structure_parent.note: The overflow CSS declaration means anything larger than this widget won't be visible.

info_game_structure_asset.note: Make sure to set movable and movableInEdit to false so you can drag around the whole icon.

info_game_structure_icon.note: The pointer-events CSS declaration means it won't stand in the way of the item under it but you also can't select it by clicking on it so you have to find it in the tree. Make sure the z here is greater than the z on the item you're enlarging.

fields.label: Play a sound when it is your turn?
Choose cursor style for all players.
